conbody.p:
Fragments serve mostly the following purposes:
Small reusable set of widgets such as navigation elements.
Default fragment: A fragment for a specific dataset for a given cardinality (one or many). This information is used when adding an association based on a linked dataset to a fragment or module. Dragging and dropping the association defined in the dataset into the Editor area will automatically retrieve the default fragment based on the linked dataset, and add it in the module (see section ). For an example, see section .
By reusing fragments, you ensure that the widgets in the fragment are displayed identically in all places in which they are used. In addition, changes or updates to the fragment are reflected in all places that use this fragment.
